html:
** Shares of consumer goods co NWL.O fall 2.7% to $25.17, extend losses for fourth straight day

** Conference Board data show U.S. consumer confidence, which takes into account consumers' assessment of current conditions and their outlook for the future, fell to a five-month low in February (Full Story)

** Mega-cap retailers Walmart WMT.N and Amazon AMZN.O down 0.8% and 1.6%, respectively

** Stocks also weighed down by sell-off in broader market as tensions between Western countries and Russia over Ukraine escalate; Nasdaq .IXIC down 1.5%, S&P 500 .SPX down 1.2%

** NWL, meanwhile, inks agreement to repurchase $275 million worth of its shares from activist investor Carl Icahn and his affiliates at $25.86/shr

** Shares of NWL, which owns brands like Parker, Oster, and Sunbeam, have gained ~15 YTD


(Reporting by Yuvraj Malik)

(( yuvraj.malik@thomsonreuters.com ))
